intro: Marlierea ternata, commonly known as the Brazilian starflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shady environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal.
